sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: This article links to various methods to launch scripts or applications automatically when some particular event is taking place.

sections.title: On bootup / shutdown
sections.content: Enable the relevant systemd services. If an application does not provide a systemd service, write your own.

sections.title: On time events
sections.content:
Periodically at certain times, dates or intervals:

- systemd/Timers
- Cron

Once at a date and time:

- systemd/Timers
- at

sections.title: On filesystem events
sections.content:
Use an inotify event watcher:

- inotify-tools, see inotifywait(1)
- incron
- fswatchAUR
- entr
- systemd can activate units on filesystem events using systemd.path(5) files

sections.title: On Xorg startup
sections.content:
- xinitrc if you are starting Xorg manually with xinit.
- xprofile if you are using a display manager.

sections.title: On desktop environment startup
sections.content:
Most desktop environments implement XDG Autostart.

If the desktop environments has an article, see its Autostart section.

- GNOME#Autostart
- KDE#Autostart
- Xfce#Autostart
- LXDE#Autostart
- LXQt#Autostart

sections.title: On window manager startup
sections.content:
